title: @Riot. What does new Base Splash Art mean for future VU's?
body: Riot, you churn out new awesome splash art every patch. For example, the new [Cho'Gath Splash](http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-2oZuvGeIgYc/VC5ezwjN0WI/AAAAAAAAaTA/Rs3u4bWNWOI/s1600/Chogath_Splash_0.jpg). It just makes me wonder, is this the direction their VU's will go eventually, or will you make a new one all over again?

replies.body:
The updated base splash art for champions are meant to illustrate how they'd literally look and feel within the world of Runeterra. =)

Regarding future visual updates for champions, yes, the updated base splash art is meant to be the direction we want to go with the champion. While the in-game model and the base splash art won’t share the same level of detail (for the sake of in-game clarity), the splash art serves as an inspirational reference point for the champion’s visual update.

These splashes, as far as I'm aware, are made with the champion *as they are in game currently*  as the primary source, coupled with some artistic lee-way. I'd say don't take these splashes as an indicator of upcoming VU's, instead think of them as Riot bringing ALL of their splash arts to the quality bar they have set for splash art. There's a good possibility that, if an extensive VU happens for any of the champions who've received updated splash arts, these splash arts will be replaced with one that makes sense with the VU.

TL;DR New splashes are to make the game better by having better art. They likely have no bearing on upcoming VU's. These new splashes may get replaced depending on the scope of an upcoming VU.
